skills.name: Cozy & Warm
skills.description: Warm palettes, layered textiles, intimate furniture. Select when user wants warmth, comfort, reading nooks, or a nurturing retreat feel.

skills.name: Modern & Clean
skills.description: Neutral base, geometric lines, sleek furniture, architectural lighting. Select when user wants a polished contemporary look. Unlike minimalist, modern allows curated display objects and color accents.

skills.name: Bright & Airy
skills.description: Light palettes, sheer curtains, natural light, transparent materials. Select when user wants to maximize luminosity and openness. Unlike more_space, this is an aesthetic (light as decor), not a spatial technique.

skills.name: Calm & Serene
skills.description: Cool muted tones, minimal pattern, sound-absorbing materials, biophilic elements. Select when user wants a retreat or spa-like feel, stress reduction, or sensory quiet. Unlike scandinavian, calm uses cool tones and avoids warm wood.

skills.name: Luxurious & Refined
skills.description: Rich fabrics, marble and brass, statement pieces, dramatic lighting. Select when user wants an upscale, hotel-suite, or jewel-box atmosphere.

skills.name: Rustic & Natural
skills.description: Reclaimed wood, wrought iron, natural stone, earth tones, artisanal objects. Select when user wants countryside warmth, organic textures, or cabin/farmhouse character.

skills.name: Minimalist & Intentional
skills.description: Monochromatic palette, architectural furniture, hidden storage, negative space. Select when user wants extreme reduction — 'less is more' taken to the max. Unlike modern, minimalist hides everything and forbids decorative display.

skills.name: Bohemian & Eclectic
skills.description: Saturated colors, mixed global patterns, layered textiles, abundant plants. Select when user wants personality, collected-over-time character, or travel-inspired warmth.

skills.name: Scandinavian & Hygge
skills.description: Pale neutrals, hygge textiles, functional furniture, plants, natural light. Select when user wants cozy-functional Nordic aesthetic with warm blonde wood. Unlike calm, scandinavian is warm-toned and embraces textural layering.

skills.name: More Space & Openness
skills.description: Visual expansion techniques, multi-functional furniture, mirrors, traffic-path optimization. Select when user mentions the room feeling small, cramped, or tight. Orthogonal — stacks with any style skill.
